page.title: 12West Wratting: Hedgerows
page.content: Many hedgerows have been removed in recent years which makes the landscape look rather stark but has improved the long distance views. Ely Cathedral, which is twenty-five kilometres to the north, can be clearly seen silhouetted on the skyline from many points in the area. The rate of hedgerow removal is slowing but is still continuing. The reasons given by the farmers for the practice of grubbing of hedgerows:- a) removing rabbit cover b) increasing light to field edges c) less maintenance now little livestock is kept. d) ease of handling large machines. e) increased growing area.
